docs.title: Welcome to Heracles
docs.text: Heracles is a comprehensive Identity Management System designed to simplify directory services, infrastructure management, and security access controls.

docs.title: Dashboard overview
docs.text: The dashboard provides a real-time view of your organization's directory status. At a glance, you can see total counts for users, groups, and systems, as well as recent activity and system health indicators.

docs.title: Administration
docs.text: Monitor system activity and configure global settings.

docs.title: Activity Log
docs.text: View a detailed history of all actions performed within the Heracles directory, including who performed the action, what was changed, and when.

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text: Manage global system preferences, integrations, and default behaviors.

docs.title: User Templates
docs.text: Define templates to standardize user creation with pre-defined attributes and group memberships.

docs.title: High-Level System Architecture
docs.text: Heracles follows a modular architecture with a clear separation of concerns between the frontend, API, core logic, and plugins.

docs.title: Components
docs.text:
• Frontend: Heracles UI (React)
    • Modern, responsive web interface built with React, Vite, and Shadcn/UI.
    • Communicates with the backend via REST API (HTTPS).
  • Backend: Heracles API (FastAPI)
    • Python-based REST API handling request validation, authentication, and business logic.
    • Integrates with Heracles Core for heavy lifting.
    • Uses Redis for caching and recurring tasks (Celery).
    • Persists application state (audit logs, settings) in PostgreSQL.
  • Core: Heracles Core (Rust)
    • High-performance library handling LDAP protocol operations, cryptography, and schema validation.
    • Exposed to Python via PyO3 bindings.
    • Communicates directly with the Directory Store.
  • Plugins: Extension System
    • Python modules that hook into the API lifecycle to extend functionality (e.g., DNS, DHCP, Sudo).
  • Data Layer:
    • OpenLDAP: The authoritative source for identity and infrastructure data.
    • PostgreSQL: Relational database for application-specific data.
    • Redis: In-memory data store for caching and queues.

docs.title: Demo Environment
docs.text: The demo environment (make demo) provisions a complete, isolated network of virtual machines using Vagrant to simulate a real-world deployment.

docs.title: Topology
docs.text:
All Virtual Machines reside on a private host-only network (192.168.56.0/24) and interact with the main Heracles infrastructure running on the host machine.

  • ns1 (192.168.56.11):
    • Role: DNS Server (BIND9).
    • Integration: Synchronizes DNS zones directly from Heracles LDAP.
  • dhcp1 (192.168.56.12):
    • Role: DHCP Server (ISC DHCP).
    • Integration: Fetches configuration and subnet definitions from Heracles LDAP.
  • mail1 (192.168.56.13):
    • Role: Mail Server (Postfix + Dovecot).
    • Integration: Authenticates users directly against Heracles LDAP.
  • server1 (192.168.56.20) & workstation1 (192.168.56.21):
    • Role: Client Machines.
    • Integration: Joined to the domain using SSSD, allowing users to log in with their Heracles credentials.

docs.title: Identity Management
docs.text: Manage the core entities of your directory: Users, Groups, and Departments (Organizational Units).

docs.title: User List
docs.text: View and search all users in the directory. You can filter by name, email, or other attributes.

docs.title: create User
docs.text: To add a new user, click the "Create User" button. Fill in the required basic information such as Username, First Name, and Last Name.

docs.title: User Details
docs.text:
Click on a user to view their full profile and manage specific settings.

  • General: Basic profile information.
  • Unix: Manage POSIX attributes like UID, GID, and Login Shell.
  • SSH Keys: Manage public SSH keys for server access.
  • Mail: Configure email attributes.
  • Groups: Manage group memberships.
  • Permissions: View assigned ACLs and effective permissions.

docs.title: Group List
docs.text: View all groups in the directory.

docs.title: Create Group
docs.text: Create new groups for organizing users and managing permissions.

docs.title: Group Details
docs.text: View group members and attributes.

docs.title: Department List
docs.text: Manage the organizational hierarchy with Departments (OUs).

docs.title: Create Department
docs.text: Add new departments to structure your directory.

docs.title: Infrastructure Management
docs.text: Manage your network infrastructure services directly from Heracles.

docs.title: Zone List
docs.text: View and manage all DNS zones (Forward and Reverse).

docs.title: Create Zone
docs.text: Create new DNS zones with ease. Supports automatic reverse zone creation.

docs.title: Zone Records
docs.text: Manage DNS records within a zone.

docs.title: Service List
docs.text: Manage DHCP server instances.

docs.title: Create Service
docs.text: Deploy new DHCP services to your network.

docs.title: Service Details
docs.text: Configure subnets, pools, and options for a specific DHCP service.

docs.title: System List
docs.text: Track all systems (servers, workstations, appliances) in your environment.

docs.title: Add System
docs.text: Register new systems to the directory.

docs.title: Security & Access Control
docs.text: Control access to infrastructure and directory resources.

docs.title: Role List
docs.text: Manage sudo roles to define privilege escalation rules for users on Unix/Linux systems.

docs.title: Create Role
docs.text: Define new sudo roles with specific commands, hosts, and user assignments.

docs.title: Policies
docs.text: View and manage ACL policies that determine what users can see and do within the Heracles directory.
